greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of divisors of n^2 that do not divide n.
comment: sigma(n^2) is always odd, so this sequence has the opposite parity from sigma(n): even if n is a square or twice a square, odd otherwise.
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = n^2 iff n is prime. - _Altug Alkan_, Oct 04 2018
mathematica: Table[DivisorSigma[1, n^2] - DivisorSigma[1, n], {n, 70}] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Oct 05 2018 *)
program: (MAGMA) [DivisorSigma(1, n^2) - DivisorSigma(1, n): n in [1..70]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Oct 05 2018
results.author: _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Oct 04 2018
